data.title: CrossFit MINS Workout
data.text: Workout of the Day 10.10.2025 WOD1.Conditioning For Time 600m Run 25 Burpees to target 60 Toes to Bar 25 Burpees to target 600m Run Sweat: 400 Meter Run Train: 45 Toes to Bar Compete: 2.Accessory 4 Sets for Quality 10 Banded Triceps Extensions 10/10 Kettlebell Side Bends 5/5 Suitcase Kettlebell Calf Raises - Rest 1 Minute -
data.full_text:
Workout of the Day

10.10.2025

WOD
1.Conditioning
For Time
600m Run
25 Burpees to target
60 Toes to Bar
25 Burpees to target
600m Run


Sweat: 400 Meter Run
Train: 45 Toes to Bar
Compete:


2.Accessory
4 Sets for Quality
10 Banded Triceps Extensions
10/10 Kettlebell Side Bends
5/5 Suitcase Kettlebell Calf Raises

- Rest 1 Minute -

ai_explanation.explanation:
Workout Overview


Hey everyone! Todayâ€™s WOD is a great mix of conditioning and accessory work designed to build your endurance and strength. Weâ€™ll kick things off with a cardio-intensive conditioning piece that includes running, burpees, and toes to bar. This will really get your heart pumping and challenge your core. After that, weâ€™ll move into some accessory work focusing on triceps, obliques, and calves to help support your overall strength and stability.


Letâ€™s break it down step by step!


Conditioning Segment [For Time]


600m Run

  • **Technique Steps:**
  • Start with a light jog to warm up your muscles.
  • Maintain an upright posture with your shoulders back and relaxed.
  • Use a midfoot strike to land softly, keeping your feet under your hips.
  • Swing your arms naturally at your sides to help with momentum.

  • **Form Tips:**
  • Keep your breathing steady; inhale through your nose and exhale through your mouth.
  • Focus on a consistent pace rather than sprinting out of the gate.

  • **Scaling/Modifications:**
  • If you're new to running or have any concerns, scale down to a 400m run or even a brisk walk.
  • Consider using a treadmill if outdoor running isnâ€™t an option.

    • 25 Burpees to Target

  • **Technique Steps:**
  • Start standing tall, then drop into a squat and place your hands on the ground.
  • Jump your feet back into a plank position, ensuring your body is in a straight line.
  • Perform a push-up (optional) and then jump your feet back towards your hands.
  • Explode up into a jump, reaching your hands towards a target (like a pull-up bar or a wall).

  • **Form Tips:**
  • Keep your core engaged throughout the movement to maintain a strong plank position.
  • Land softly on your feet when jumping up.

  • **Scaling/Modifications:**
  • Step back into the plank instead of jumping if you need to reduce impact.
  • You can also perform a burpee without the push-up for a less intense version.

    • 60 Toes to Bar

  • **Technique Steps:**
  • Hang from a pull-up bar with a grip slightly wider than shoulder-width.
  • Engage your core and initiate the movement by bringing your knees up towards your chest.
  • Once your knees are up, extend your legs and bring your toes to the bar, aiming to touch it with your toes.

  • **Form Tips:**
  • Keep your shoulders engaged and avoid swinging too much.
  • Focus on using your core rather than just your hip flexors.

  • **Scaling/Modifications:**
  • If toes to bar are too challenging, scale to knee raises or hanging knee tucks.
  • You can also perform the movement on a lower bar or use a band for assistance.

    • 25 Burpees to Target (Repeat)

  • Just like before, focus on maintaining good form and pacing yourself through this second set of burpees.

    • 600m Run (Repeat)

  • Finish strong with another 600m run, keeping your form in check and pushing through to the end!

    • Accessory Segment [4 Sets for Quality]


    10 Banded Triceps Extensions

  • **Technique Steps:**
  • Secure a resistance band overhead or to a sturdy object.
  • Stand with your back to the band, holding the band with both hands behind your head.
  • Extend your arms straight up, fully extending your elbows.

  • **Form Tips:**
  • Keep your elbows close to your head throughout the movement.
  • Avoid arching your back; keep your core engaged.

  • **Scaling/Modifications:**
  • Use a lighter band if youâ€™re struggling to maintain form.
  • You can also perform this movement with a dumbbell if bands are not available.

    • 10/10 Kettlebell Side Bends

  • **Technique Steps:**
  • Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart, holding a kettlebell in one hand.
  • Slowly bend to the side, bringing the kettlebell down towards your knee.
  • Return to the starting position, engaging your obliques as you lift back up.

  • **Form Tips:**
  • Keep your back straight and avoid leaning forward or backward.
  • Focus on controlled movements rather than rushing through.

  • **Scaling/Modifications:**
  • Use a lighter kettlebell or perform the movement without weight to focus on form.

    • 5/5 Suitcase Kettlebell Calf Raises

  • **Technique Steps:**
  • Hold a kettlebell in one hand and stand tall.
  • Raise up onto the balls of your feet, squeezing your calves at the top.
  • Lower back down slowly and repeat.

  • **Form Tips:**
  • Keep your core engaged to maintain balance.
  • Avoid rolling your ankles; keep your feet straight.

  • **Scaling/Modifications:**
  • Perform calf raises without weight if needed.
  • You can also do these on a step for a greater range of motion.

    • Rest 1 Minute

  • Use this time to hydrate and prepare for the next set. Focus on your breathing and shake out any tight muscles.

    • Loading and Rep-Modification Options


  • **Sweat:**
  • 400m Run, 15 Burpees, 30 Toes to Bar (focus on form and pacing).

  • **Train:**
  • Stick with the prescribed reps but consider scaling the run to 500m if needed.

  • **Compete:**
  • Go for the full workout as prescribed, aiming for a strong finish. Push your limits but listen to your body!

    • Strategy Advice

  • For the conditioning piece, pacing is key. Start strong but find a rhythm that you can maintain throughout the workout. Break up the burpees and toes to bar into manageable sets if needed. For the accessory work, focus on quality over quantity; itâ€™s about building strength, so take your time with each rep.

    • Alright team, letâ€™s get after it! Remember to have fun and challenge yourselves today! ðŸ’ª

combined_content.title: CrossFit MINS Workout
combined_content.workout_text:
WOD:


  • Conditioning
  • For Time:
  • 600m Run
  • 25 Burpees to target
  • 60 Toes to Bar
  • 25 Burpees to target
  • 600m Run

  • Sweat: 400 Meter Run
  • Train: 45 Toes to Bar

  • Accessory
  • 4 Sets for Quality:
  • 10 Banded Triceps Extensions
  • 10/10 Kettlebell Side Bends
  • 5/5 Suitcase Kettlebell Calf Raises
  • Rest 1 Minute

For Time

--- AI EXPLANATION --- # Workout Overview Hey everyone! Todayâ€™s WOD is a great mix of conditioning and accessory work designed to build your endurance and strength. Weâ€™ll kick things off with a cardio-intensive conditioning piece that includes running, burpees, and toes to bar. This will really get your heart pumping and challenge your core. After that, weâ€™ll move into some accessory work focusing on triceps, obliques, and calves to help support your overall strength and stability. Letâ€™s break it down step by step! ## Conditioning Segment [For Time] ### 600m Run - **Technique Steps:** - Start with a light jog to warm up your muscles. - Maintain an upright posture with your shoulders back and relaxed. - Use a midfoot strike to land softly, keeping your feet under your hips. - Swing your arms naturally at your sides to help with momentum. - **Form Tips:** - Keep your breathing steady; inhale through your nose and exhale through your mouth. - Focus on a consistent pace rather than sprinting out of the gate. - **Scaling/Modifications:** - If you're new to running or have any concerns, scale down to a 400m run or even a brisk walk. - Consider using a treadmill if outdoor running isnâ€™t an option. ### 25 Burpees to Target - **Technique Steps:** - Start standing tall, then drop into a squat and place your hands on the ground. - Jump your feet back into a plank position, ensuring your body is in a straight line. - Perform a push-up (optional) and then jump your feet back towards your hands. - Explode up into a jump, reaching your hands towards a target (like a pull-up bar or a wall). - **Form Tips:** - Keep your core engaged throughout the movement to maintain a strong plank position. - Land softly on your feet when jumping up. - **Scaling/Modifications:** - Step back into the plank instead of jumping if you need to reduce impact. - You can also perform a burpee without the push-up for a less intense version. ### 60 Toes to Bar - **Technique Steps:** - Hang from a pull-up bar with a grip slightly wider than shoulder-width. - Engage your core and initiate the movement by bringing your knees up towards your chest. - Once your knees are up, extend your legs and bring your toes to the bar, aiming to touch it with your toes. - **Form Tips:** - Keep your shoulders engaged and avoid swinging too much. - Focus on using your core rather than just your hip flexors. - **Scaling/Modifications:** - If toes to bar are too challenging, scale to knee raises or hanging knee tucks. - You can also perform the movement on a lower bar or use a band for assistance. ### 25 Burpees to Target (Repeat) - Just like before, focus on maintaining good form and pacing yourself through this second set of burpees. ### 600m Run (Repeat) - Finish strong with another 600m run, keeping your form in check and pushing through to the end! ## Accessory Segment [4 Sets for Quality] ### 10 Banded Triceps Extensions - **Technique Steps:** - Secure a resistance band overhead or to a sturdy object. - Stand with your back to the band, holding the band with both hands behind your head. - Extend your arms straight up, fully extending your elbows. - **Form Tips:** - Keep your elbows close to your head throughout the movement. - Avoid arching your back; keep your core engaged. - **Scaling/Modifications:** - Use a lighter band if youâ€™re struggling to maintain form. - You can also perform this movement with a dumbbell if bands are not available. ### 10/10 Kettlebell Side Bends - **Technique Steps:** - Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart, holding a kettlebell in one hand. - Slowly bend to the side, bringing the kettlebell down towards your knee. - Return to the starting position, engaging your obliques as you lift back up. - **Form Tips:** - Keep your back straight and avoid leaning forward or backward. - Focus on controlled movements rather than rushing through. - **Scaling/Modifications:** - Use a lighter kettlebell or perform the movement without weight to focus on form. ### 5/5 Suitcase Kettlebell Calf Raises - **Technique Steps:** - Hold a kettlebell in one hand and stand tall. - Raise up onto the balls of your feet, squeezing your calves at the top. - Lower back down slowly and repeat. - **Form Tips:** - Keep your core engaged to maintain balance. - Avoid rolling your ankles; keep your feet straight. - **Scaling/Modifications:** - Perform calf raises without weight if needed. - You can also do these on a step for a greater range of motion. ### Rest 1 Minute - Use this time to hydrate and prepare for the next set. Focus on your breathing and shake out any tight muscles. ## Loading and Rep-Modification Options - **Sweat:** - 400m Run, 15 Burpees, 30 Toes to Bar (focus on form and pacing). - **Train:** - Stick with the prescribed reps but consider scaling the run to 500m if needed. - **Compete:** - Go for the full workout as prescribed, aiming for a strong finish. Push your limits but listen to your body! ### Strategy Advice - For the conditioning piece, pacing is key. Start strong but find a rhythm that you can maintain throughout the workout. Break up the burpees and toes to bar into manageable sets if needed. For the accessory work, focus on quality over quantity; itâ€™s about building strength, so take your time with each rep. Alright team, letâ€™s get after it! Remember to have fun and challenge yourselves today! ðŸ’ª
